body:
Hey, I tried to reproduce locally and could not. 
https://gist.github.com/nsivabalan/7d6ea90ebfa76f9a53abedfa562562b7

can you confirm few things:
1. is your table MOR?
2. If yes, do you have any file groups with any base files but just log files? From the code, I see hudi clustering considers only  parquet file size and not the log file sizes.
3. Can you enable info logging and let us know what you see for "Adding one clustering group"

Hi, I was facing this error last weeks, and now, I guess I fixed data pipeline just adjusting AWS EMR versions that it was using Hudi to write to s3 buckets.
Data Pipeline workflow here was using EMR 6.5, EMR 6.4, and in some cases, EMR 5.33.1, and now that all processes is using EMR 6.5, we dont have broken pipeline with that version error.
I Hope it helps @nsivabalan and @codejoyan
thanks @singaretti  for the update. glad to know everything is resolved now.
@aditiwari01 : sorry, can you point me to the patch which you have put up on this regard. I can take a stab at it. I have filed a jira [here](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-3130).
@stym06 : Can you give this a try https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/3222. would help to certify the patch too.

@xushiyan - Thanks for confirming that it works with 3.1.2, my initial error was on Spark 3.1.1, after your last message, I updated my Spark to 3.1.2, now it works.

dbt currently uses Spark 3.0.2, even if they update it will be to Spark 3.1.1, Can you please make it work with Spark 3.1.1?
Looking into the failures.
@minihippo I was thinking we can name all parameters `hoodie.storage.layout..` instead, but the space curve PRs are all named `hoodie.layout.optimize` anyway. So I think its ok

Thanks. I have seen the PR.
[Link](https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/4470)
I will close it.

For our internal hudi version, we shade aws dependencies, you can add new relocation and build a new bundle package:

For example, to shade aws dependencies in spark, add following codes in **packaging/hudi-spark-bundle/pom.xml**

```xml
<!-- line 185-->
<relocation>
 <pattern>com.amazonaws.</pattern>
 <shadedPattern>${spark.bundle.spark.shade.prefix}com.amazonaws.</shadedPattern>
</relocation>
```

sorry, it is for Hadoop 2.

> 
> SQL will persist the database name to ` hoodie.properties` by default, DF is selectively persisted through optional database parameters. Then, in incremental query, if set ` databaseName.tableName`, we match `databaseName.tableName`. If it is inconsistent or there is no databaseName, incremental query will not be performed. If consistent, perform an incremental query.If the incremental query does not have a database name set, does not match the database name, only the table name

The solution is to shade and relocate aws dependencies introduced in hudi-aws:
> For our internal hudi version, we shade aws dependencies, you can add new relocation and build a new bundle package:
> 
> For example, to shade aws dependencies in spark, add following codes in **packaging/hudi-spark-bundle/pom.xml**
> 
> ```
> <!-- line 185-->
> <relocation>
>  <pattern>com.amazonaws.</pattern>
>  <shadedPattern>${spark.bundle.spark.shade.prefix}com.amazonaws.</shadedPattern>
> </relocation>
> ```
